CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is currently serving a sentence in a correctional colony in LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of robbery . On DATE the ORG of GPE authorised his detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the detention . That detention order was upheld on appeal on CARDINAL DATE by ORG .
CARDINAL . Another extensions of detention followed on DATE and DATE . The applicant appealed against both detention orders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was convicted as charged and sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The conviction became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in reply to the applicant ’s complaint about the failure to examine his appeal , ORG informed him that his appeal against the detention order of CARDINAL DATE was not received by ORG . However , by a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG forwarded the applicant ’s appeal statement lodged on DATE to ORG , requiring it to perform procedural steps necessary to initiate the appeal proceedings . ORG also informed the applicant that his appeal complaint of CARDINAL DATE was mistakenly attached to another case - file .
CARDINAL . No further information on organisation of the appeal hearing against the detention order of DATE was provided .
